可选择性(selectivity)：比较一下列中唯一键的数量和表中的行数，就可以判断该列的可选择性。如果该列的”唯一键的数量/表中的行数…

entry.tran: 选择性的;有选择的;选取少量的
entry.def: A selective process applies only to a few things or people.

example.ex: Selective breeding may result in a greyhound running faster and seeing better than a wolf.
example.tran: 选择性交配繁殖有可能培育出比狼速度更快、视力更佳的灵犭是。

entry.tran: 仔细挑选的;严格筛选的
entry.def: When someone is selective, they choose things carefully, for example the things that they buy or do.

example.ex: Sales still happen, but buyers are more selective...
example.tran: 销量仍在，但购买者更加挑剔。

example.ex: If public figures seek publicity to further their careers, they can't be selective about it.
example.tran: 如果公众人物想通过吸引公众的关注来推进事业，他们可能会不加选择。

entry.tran: (记忆)选择性的，只记一部分的
entry.def: If you say that someone has a selective memory, you disapprove of the fact that they remember certain facts about something and deliberately forget others, often because it is convenient for them to do so.

example.ex: We seem to have a selective memory for the best bits of the past...
example.tran: 我们似乎只记得过去最美好的时光。

example.ex: Mr Robins, suffering from selective amnesia about his role in the affair, was contradicted in nearly every instance by other witnesses.
example.tran: 对于自己在该事件中所扮演的角色，罗宾斯先生患上了选择性失忆症，因此几乎在每次庭审中都会受到其他证人的反驳。

means.word_mean: 1. tending to select; characterized by careful choice;

sentences.sentence: "an exceptionally quick and selective reader"- John Mason Brown

means.word_mean: 2. characterized by very careful or fastidious selection;

sentences.sentence: "the school was very selective in its admissions"

auth_sentence.content: Being more selective would very much serve our interests.

auth_sentence.res_content: The theory of memory traces as selective resonator systems.

auth_sentence.content: I disagree that selective breeding is not genetic modification.
auth_sentence.res_content: I disagree that selective breeding is not genetic modification.

Sentence.sentence: If pop singers have got voice problems, they really need to be more selective about where they work.
Nearly all application materials are submitted online, and the Common Application provides a one-size-fits form accepted by more than 400 schools, including the nation's most selective

Still, at the most selective schools, where thousands of candidates may submit identically high grades and test scores, a marginal item like the essay may serve as a tie-breaker between two equally qualified candidates.

sentences.en: She is selective about the clothes she buys.
He seemed to have a very selective recall of past events.
sentences.cn: 他好像对过去的事情有选择地回忆。
